definitions.definition: An act of hauling or pulling, particularly with force; a (violent) pull or tug.
The distance over which something is hauled or transported, especially if long.
definitions.example: Getting to his place was a real haul.

definitions.definition: An amount of something that has been taken, especially of fish, illegal loot, or items purchased on a shopping trip.
definitions.example: The robber’s haul was over thirty items.

definitions.definition: (ropemaking) A bundle of many threads to be tarred.
To transport by drawing or pulling, as with horses or oxen, or a motor vehicle.
definitions.example: to haul logs to a sawmill

definitions.definition: To draw or pull something heavy.
To carry or transport something, with a connotation that the item is heavy or otherwise difficult to move.
To drag, to pull, to tug.
Followed by up: to summon to be disciplined or held answerable for something.
To pull apart, as oxen sometimes do when yoked.
To steer (a vessel) closer to the wind.
Of the wind: to shift fore (more towards the bow).

definitions.example: “How fast was he goin’?” / “I don’t know exactly, but he must’ve been haulin’, given where he landed.”
